TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TextToSpeech extends Java.Lang.Object

Docs.summary: Synthesizes speech from text for immediate playback or to create a sound file.

remarks.para: Synthesizes speech from text for immediate playback or to create a sound file.

A TextToSpeech instance can only be used to synthesize text once it has completed its initialization. Implement the to be notified of the completion of the initialization.
When you are done using the TextToSpeech instance, call the method to release the native resources used by the TextToSpeech engine.

MemberSignature.Value: public const string ActionTtsQueueProcessingCompleted;
.field public static literal string ActionTtsQueueProcessingCompleted

Docs.summary: Broadcast Action: The TextToSpeech synthesizer has completed processing of all the text in the speech queue.

remarks.para:
Broadcast Action: The TextToSpeech synthesizer has completed processing of all the text in the speech queue.
Note that this notifies callers when the engine has finished has processing text data. Audio playback might not have completed (or even started) at this point. If you wish to be notified when this happens, see .

Docs.summary: Adds a mapping between a CharSequence (may be spanned with TtsSpans and a sound file.

remarks.para: Adds a mapping between a CharSequence (may be spanned with TtsSpans and a sound file. Using this, it is possible to add custom pronounciations for a string of text. After a call to this method, subsequent calls to will play the specified sound resource if it is available, or synthesize the text it is missing.

Pass the packagename of the application that contains the resource. If the resource is in your own application (this is the most common case), then put the packagename of your application here.

The packagename can be found in the AndroidManifest.xml of your application.
<manifest xmlns:android="..." package="com.google.marvin.compass">

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<string> GetFeatures (Java.Util.Locale locale);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.ICollection`1<string> GetFeatures(class Java.Util.Locale locale) cil managed

Docs.param: The locale to query features for.
Docs.summary: Queries the engine for the set of features it supports for a given locale.

remarks.para:
Queries the engine for the set of features it supports for a given locale. Features can either be framework defined, e.g. or engine specific. Engine specific keys must be prefixed by the name of the engine they are intended for. These keys can be used as parameters to and .
Features values are strings and their values must meet restrictions described in their documentation.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsSpeaking { get; }
.property instance bool IsSpeaking

Docs.summary: Checks whether the TTS engine is busy speaking.

remarks.para: Checks whether the TTS engine is busy speaking. Note that a speech item is considered complete once it's audio data has been sent to the audio mixer, or written to a file. There might be a finite lag between this point, and when the audio hardware completes playback.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Java.Util.Locale Language { get; }
.property instance class Java.Util.Locale Language

Docs.summary: Returns a Locale instance describing the language currently being used for synthesis requests sent to the TextToSpeech engine.

remarks.para:
Returns a Locale instance describing the language currently being used for synthesis requests sent to the TextToSpeech engine.
In Android 4.2 and before (API <= 17) this function returns the language that is currently being used by the TTS engine. That is the last language set by this or any other client by a call to the same engine.
In Android versions after 4.2 this function returns the language that is currently being used for the synthesis requests sent from this client. That is the last language set by a call on this instance.
If a voice is set (by ), getLanguage will return the language of the currently set voice.
Please note that the Locale object returned by this method is NOT a valid Locale object. Its language field contains a three-letter ISO 639-2/T code (where a proper Locale would use a two-letter ISO 639-1 code), and the country field contains a three-letter ISO 3166 country code (where a proper Locale would use a two-letter ISO 3166-1 code).

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult PlayEarcon(string earcon, valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, class System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary`2<string, string> params) cil managed

Docs.summary: Plays the earcon using the specified queueing mode and parameters.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult PlayEarcon (string earcon, Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, Android.OS.Bundle params, string utteranceId);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult PlayEarcon(string earcon, valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.QueueMode queueMode, class Android.OS.Bundle params, string utteranceId) cil managed

Docs.param: The earcon that should be played

Parameters for the request. Can be null. Supported parameter names: , Engine specific parameters may be passed in but the parameter keys must be prefixed by the name of the engine they are intended for. For example the keys "com.svox.pico_foo" and "com.svox.pico:bar" will be passed to the engine named "com.svox.pico" if it is being used.
Docs.summary: Plays the earcon using the specified queueing mode and parameters.

remarks.para: Plays the earcon using the specified queueing mode and parameters. The earcon must already have been added with or . This method is asynchronous, i.e. the method just adds the request to the queue of TTS requests and then returns. The synthesis might not have finished (or even started!) at the time when this method returns. In order to reliably detect errors during synthesis, we recommend setting an utterance progress listener (see ) and using the parameter.

Docs.summary: Plays silence for the specified amount of time using the specified queue mode.

remarks.para: Plays silence for the specified amount of time using the specified queue mode. This method is asynchronous, i.e. the method just adds the request to the queue of TTS requests and then returns. The synthesis might not have finished (or even started!) at the time when this method returns. In order to reliably detect errors during synthesis, we recommend setting an utterance progress listener (see ) and using the parameter.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.LanguageAvailableResult SetLanguage (Java.Util.Locale loc);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Android.Speech.Tts.LanguageAvailableResult SetLanguage(class Java.Util.Locale loc) cil managed

Docs.param: The locale describing the language to be used.
Docs.summary: Sets the text-to-speech language.

remarks.para:
Sets the text-to-speech language. The TTS engine will try to use the closest match to the specified language as represented by the Locale, but there is no guarantee that the exact same Locale will be used. Use to check the level of support before choosing the language to use for the next utterances.
This method sets the current voice to the default one for the given Locale; can be used to retrieve it.

Docs.param: Speech pitch. 1.0 is the normal pitch, lower values lower the tone of the synthesized voice, greater values increase it.

remarks.para:
Sets the speech pitch for the TextToSpeech engine.
This has no effect on any pre-recorded speech.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Speech.Tts.OperationResult SetSpeechRate (float speechRate);

Docs.param: Speech rate. 1.0 is the normal speech rate, lower values slow down the speech (0.5 is half the normal speech rate), greater values accelerate it (2.0 is twice the normal speech rate).
Docs.summary: Sets the speech rate.

remarks.para:
Sets the speech rate.
This has no effect on any pre-recorded speech.

Docs.summary: Releases the resources used by the TextToSpeech engine.

remarks.para: Releases the resources used by the TextToSpeech engine. It is good practice for instance to call this method in the onDestroy() method of an Activity so the TextToSpeech engine can be cleanly stopped.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which contains the java.lang.Class JNI value corresponding to this type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control which jclass is provided to methods like .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.

Docs.summary: Query the engine about the set of available voices.

Query the engine about the set of available voices.
Each TTS Engine can expose multiple voices for each locale, each with a different set of features.
